articles.author: Sky
articles.description: There are fears that variants imported from Europe could damage the success of the UK's vaccination programme.
articles.title: COVID-19: Calls for UK government to allow foreign travel, as scientists warn of dangers from Europe's third wave - Sky News

articles.description: Anger at restrictions imposed to contain the coronavirus pandemic spilled into the streets of Germany and the U.K. on Saturday.
articles.title: Protesters Across Europe Clash With Police Over COVID-19 Lockdowns - NPR

articles.content: This is an excerpt from Second Opinion, a weekly roundup of health and medical science news emailed to subscribers every Saturday morning. If you haven't subscribed yet, you can do that by clicking h… [+8414 chars]
articles.description: Scientists in Europe have reportedly found a link between the AstraZeneca-Oxford COVID-19 vaccine and extremely rare but potentially fatal blood clots, but Canadian public health officials have so far provided no update on guidance for the shot.
articles.title: Canada hesitates to update guidance on AstraZeneca-Oxford vaccine amid potential link to blood clots - CBC.ca

articles.title: WHO engages health workers in Romania to reach out on the benefits of COVID-19 vaccines in pilot project - WHO/Europe

articles.content:
A medical worker prepares a dose of AstraZeneca's COVID-19 vaccine at a vaccination centre.
Jakarta: Indonesia's Food and Drug agency (BPOM) said on Friday it has approved the usage of AstraZeneca's… [+2047 chars]
articles.description: Indonesia's Food and Drug agency (BPOM) said on Friday it has approved the usage of AstraZeneca's COVID-19 vaccine after reviewing reports that it had caused blood clots among some recipients in Europe.
articles.title: Indonesia To Resume Use Of AstraZeneca's COVID-19 Vaccine - NDTV
